message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you our premium product at a special introductory price of $9,500. This is a limited-time offer, so I encourage you to consider it carefully. Thank you for your interest!

Thanks for the offer, Alice.  $9,500 is a bit high for me. I'm willing to pay $8,500 for the product. This is a fair price for both of us, and I'm confident we can reach an agreement. What do you say?

Thank you for your prompt response, Bob. I appreciate your offer, but I must respectfully decline. Considering the value and quality of the product, I believe we can find a mutually beneficial price. I am willing to consider $9,000 for the product. I hope this proposal will be more agreeable to you.

Alice, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. However, $9,000 is still a bit too high for me.  I'm prepared to pay $8,750, which is a good compromise.  This price reflects the value of the product while allowing you to make a profit. I'm confident we can close this deal.

I understand your position, Bob, and I'm glad you're willing to negotiate. After careful consideration, I am willing to accept $8,900 for the product. I believe this price strikes a good balance between the value of the product and my profit margin. I hope this offer will be acceptable to you.
